title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Part (a)—2 points; 1 point per description.

One point was given for each of two declarative statements that acceptably described
problems for presidents posed by divided government.

Acceptable reasons included greater likelihood of policy conflict and the inability to fill offices.
descriptions: The student failed to provide any description.

The student provided one correct description. 

Acceptable reasons included greater likelihood of policy conflict and the inability to fill offices.

The student provided two correct description. 

Acceptable reasons included greater likelihood of policy conflict and the inability to fill offices.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Part (b)—4 points; 1 point for each of two identifications, 1 point for each of two explanations

One point was awarded for each of two identifications.

A second point was awarded for each of two explanations, but only after adequate identification.

Any explanation had to answer how a president’s efforts overcome problems. Some acceptable ways in which presidents overcome the problems of divided government include engaging in ideological compromise, building coalitions with interest groups, building coalitions in Congress, making interim recess appointments, generating public support, conducting more intense background screening of nominees, and using the threat of a veto.
